## GAD-7 vs HCL-32

Psychologists and social scientists often engage in research related to generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) and hypomania. The two commonly used tools they usually employ are GAD-7 and HCL-32 questionnaires. The challenge, however, lies in harmonising and comparing these items in a clear, objective, and time-efficient manner. This is where Harmony comes in as an essential tool for the GAD-7 vs HCL-32 comparative analysis. Harmony, with its advanced AI natural language processing capabilities, enables researchers to accurately analyze and compare the items in the GAD-7 and HCL-32 questionnaires. Using advanced neural network models, it is able to achieve a high percentage match between each item in these instruments. This allows researchers to evaluate the results across multiple studies, ensuring consistent, objective, and reliable comparisons in the GAD-7 vs HCL-32 analyses. By opting for Harmony, researchers no longer have to spend countless hours manually comparing GAD-7 and HCL-32 items. It provides multilingual support, allowing for effective and efficient comparisons even in different languages. With Harmony, the GAD-7 vs HCL-32 comparison becomes a quick, efficient, and streamlined process, ultimately paving the way for more insightful and comprehensive research outcomes.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and HCL-32

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and HCL-32 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just HCL-32 into Harmony</a> - compare HCL-32 with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
